who I am that's the way to survive based
on a true story 12 years of slave is a
movie about an african-american Freeman
who in 1841 was snatched off the streets
of Washington and sold into slavery in
her review Manohla Dargis writes 12
years a slave is an argument about
American slavery that both reveals it as
a system and demolishes its canards
myths and cherished symbols there are no
messages wagging fingers or final act
summations or sermons Master Bochy hey
lark that's all mister McQueen's method
is more effective and subversive because
of its primarily old-fashioned Hollywood
style engagement any moral earn you a
hundred lash director Steve McQueen
keeps everything moving so fluidly and
efficiently that you're too busy
worrying about the main character
Solomon Northup played by Chu Attell
Ejiofor to linger long in the emotions
and ideas that the movie turns up the
genius of 12 years a slave is its
insistence on banal evil men terror that
seeped into souls and enduring the
painter or the forger
directed by David O'Russell American
hustle is loosely based on the Abscam

review and all the darkest rites

excesses of its era though it's a forest
that speaks as well to this tarnished
age all the shiny surfaces also suggest

gravity is a 3d movie about the struggle
for survival in terrible rapidly
changing circumstances and his review AO
Scott writes as our eyes adjusts to the
vast darkness we detect movement that is
recognizably human and here familiar
voices astronauts movie stars Sandra
Bullock and George Clooney in spacesuits
the main challenge facing the director
Alfonso Quran is not visualizing the
unimaginable so much as overcoming the
audience's assumption that we've seen it
all before
mr. Quran succeeds by tethering almost
unfathomably complex techniques both
digital and analog to a simple narrative
gravity is less science fiction
spectacle than a Jack London tale in
orbit the standard for a movie like this
one is not realism but coherence every
true outlaw has a code the laws of
physics are no exception and mr. Caron
violates them with ingenious and
exuberant rigor
